answers.answer: Congratulations Paula!!!  That's fantastic news, keep the faith!!  I had my first hcg come back at 568 on 5/21 and then today i had another at 4570.  I am also thinking I may be carrying twins!  Just stay in constant touch with your Dr and they will make sure you are ok, they know about your diabetes and they also want you to stay healthy and deliver your precious babies, just do everything they tell you to do without fail and you;ll be fine!  Congrats again sweetie!
Congratulations, that is awesome news! I agree w/cindyann, just follow the Dr's orders. You should be fine and always stay positive!
wow congradulations, thats great exciting and scary

Congratulations!  Seeing two little sacs is so amazing!  I too went through IVF and saw two sacs and now I'm 15 weeks pregnant with twins!  i know the feeling of being excited and scared, and I feel I worry even more that they'll both be ok, but it will all work out and you'll be a great mom!  If you ever want to chat, I'm here!  Let me know how it goes at your next appointment!

I bet you are going to deliver them at good time,,with good health,,,its nice to get twins dear,,,,i just love that,,,,wow,,,oohhhoooo,,iam happpppppppppppy for you,,,,And then i have heard that there is no problem is you take your tabs properly,,

I know it might be scary but I think that as long as you're careful and closely monitored that it's a great thing!!!! I wish you all the best :) !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Keep everyone updated on how it's going with you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

question: I had my ultrasound today and there are two little yolk sacs in there!  The doctor says don't run out and buy two cribs just yet 'cause it's too soon (I had IVF four weeks ago) but still......I am excited and scared at the same time.  I think it'd be great to have twins but I know that makes me even MORE high risk since I am 41 and have Type II Diabetes.Any similar stories?  Advice?
title: OMG Two!!
